Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that President Trump said that Americans had no right to protest against him. The expert's verdict states that Trump did not say that Americans had no right whatsoever to protest against him.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that President Trump said Americans had no right to protest against him, while the expert's verdict clarifies that Trump's lawyers argued that protesters had "no right" to protest "as part of the campaign rally of the political candidates they oppose."
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the assumption that President Trump said Americans had no right to protest against him, which is not supported by the expert's verdict.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict provides an alternative explanation by stating that although Trump's lawyers argued that the protesters had "no right" to protest at his campaign rally, the President did not say that this applied to all Americans protesting against him at other times or locations.
